channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syrian families scour hospitals and morgues for loved ones lost under Assad's rule
item.description: People in Syria are looking for their relatives and friends in prisons, hospitals and morgues. The U.N. estimates over 100,00 people have gone missing...

item.title: Anti-whaling activist Paul Watson released from jail in Greenland
item.description: Danish authorities reject a Japanese bid to extradite the campaigner because of his time spent in detention.

item.title: Wait continues for details on short-term spending bill to keep government running
item.description: Congress has until Friday at midnight to pass a short-term spending bill and avoid a government shutdown, but the text of the bill has yet to be relea...

item.title: Judge blocks rule preventing transgender people from changing their sex on documents
EU investigates TikTok over alleged Russian meddling in Romanian vote
item.description: Romania's election was cancelled after thousands of TikTok accounts were activated backing a little-known candidate.

item.title: Motive is next key task for police investigating Wisconsin fatal school shooting
item.description: Investigators in Wisconsin are trying to determine a motive in a school shooting that left a teacher and a student dead and two other children in crit...

item.title: How the holidays could be affecting your medical care
item.description: A new study suggests that holidays can affect your provider's decision making.

item.title: What to know about the shooting at a Christian school in Wisconsin
Ukraine's spies target Russian figures in increasingly brazen attacks
item.description: Attacks on Russian figures have become more brazen as Ukrainian special services penetrate security in Moscow.

item.title: Verdict to be announced soon in Cash App murder case
item.description: A verdict has been reached and will be announced soon in the trial of Nima Momeni, the man accused of fatally stabbing Cash App founder Bob Lee in 202...

item.title: The suspect in the Gilgo Beach killings is charged in the death of a 7th woman
item.description: The New York architect facing murder charges in a string of deaths known as the Gilgo Beach killings was charged in the death of Valerie Mack, 24, who...

item.title: Express failed to disclose $1 million in perks to ex-CEO, SEC says
item.description: Investors were kept in the dark about expenses including chief executive's personal use of chartered aircraft, regulator alleges.

item.title: At the Florida Senior Games, pickleball is the crown jewel. Here's why
item.description: Pickleball is the fastest-growing sport and it's also popular with older athletes. All Things Considered went to the Florida Senior Games to find out ...

item.title: Los Zetas cartel boss re-arrested in Mexico after US jail time
item.description: Osiel Cárdenas Guillén founded the feared group of brutal cartel hitmen known as Los Zetas.

item.title: Deadly Wisconsin school shooting. And, a pig kidney transplant surgery provides hope
item.description: A Wisconsin school shooting left multiple people dead and several injured. Here's the latest. And, a milestone pig kidney transplant provides doctors ...

item.title: Retired FBI official on Wisconsin school shooting
item.description: Chris Piehota, retired FBI executive assistant director, joined CBS News to discuss Monday's school shooting in Madison, Wisconsin, that killed two pe...

item.title: Lawmakers scramble on government funding as shutdown deadline nears
item.description: Leaders in Congress have yet to unveil their plan to keep the government funded, facing a Friday night deadline to avert a government shutdown.

item.title: General killed in Moscow a legitimate target, says Ukraine
item.description: Ukrainian sources tell the BBC the country's security service was behind the killings.
